skill.name: clinvar-database
skill.description: Query NCBI ClinVar for variant clinical significance. Search by gene/position, interpret pathogenicity classifications, access via E-utilities API or FTP, annotate VCFs, for genomic medicine.
skill.summary: Query NCBI ClinVar for variant clinical significance. Search by gene/position, interpret pathogenici...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill. Contains no executable code, scripts, or file system operations. Pure informational content about NCBI ClinVar database access and clinical significance interpretation.

content.user_title: Query ClinVar for variant clinical significance
content.value_statement: ClinVar is the authoritative database for genetic variant interpretations. This skill enables you to search for pathogenic variants, understand clinical significance classifications, and annotate genomic datasets using NCBI's E-utilities API and FTP downloads.
actual_capabilities: Search ClinVar by gene, variant, or clinical significance using E-utilities API
Interpret ACMG/AMP classifications: Pathogenic, VUS, Benign, and review star ratings
Download bulk ClinVar data in XML, VCF, or tab-delimited formats via FTP
Annotate VCF files with clinical significance using bcftools or Python
Resolve conflicting variant interpretations using review status and evidence
Track variant classification updates and understand reclassification patterns
limitations: Not for direct clinical diagnosis without genetics professional review
VCF format excludes variants larger than 10kb and complex structural variants
API rate limited to 3 requests/second without API key
VUS (uncertain significance) variants have insufficient evidence for clinical use

use_cases.title: Find high-confidence pathogenic variants
use_cases.description: Search for pathogenic variants with expert panel review status to support clinical interpretation of patient sequencing data.

use_cases.title: Annotate variant call sets
use_cases.description: Download ClinVar VCF and annotate sequencing results with clinical significance classifications for research analysis.

use_cases.title: Understand variant classifications
use_cases.description: Explain clinical significance categories, review status ratings, and conflicting interpretations to patients and families.

prompt_templates.title: Search pathogenic variants
prompt_templates.scenario: Find pathogenic variants in a gene
prompt_templates.prompt: Search ClinVar for all Pathogenic variants in the BRCA1 gene with expert panel review. Show the review status and clinical significance for each variant.

prompt_templates.title: Interpret clinical significance
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the ClinVar clinical significance classification for a variant labeled 'Conflicting interpretations of pathogenicity'. How should this be interpreted?

prompt_templates.title: Download and process data
prompt_templates.prompt: What FTP files should I download to build a local ClinVar database for variant annotation? Include file formats and download commands.

prompt_templates.title: Annotate VCF files
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to use bcftools to annotate my VCF file with ClinVar clinical significance and review status information.

output_examples.input: Find pathogenic variants in TP53 gene with expert panel review
output: Found 45 Pathogenic/Likely Pathogenic TP53 variants with expert panel review:
â€¢ TP53:c.818G>A (R273H) - Pathogenic - â˜…â˜…â˜… Expert Panel Review
â€¢ TP53:c.743G>A (R248Q) - Pathogenic - â˜…â˜…â˜… Expert Panel Review
â€¢ TP53:c.817C>T (R273C) - Pathogenic - â˜…â˜…â˜… Expert Panel Review
All variants associated with Li-Fraumeni syndrome. Review status indicates high-confidence classifications reviewed by ClinGen expert panel.

best_practices: Always check review status (star ratings) - prioritize â˜…â˜…â˜… and â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜… variants for clinical use
Document the ClinVar version and access date for reproducibility in research
Cross-reference with population frequency data (gnomAD) and functional studies when available
anti_patterns: Using single-star variants for clinical decision-making without manual evidence review
Treating VUS (uncertain significance) variants as diagnostic evidence

faq.question: Which ClinVar review status is most reliable?
faq.answer: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜… Practice guideline and â˜…â˜…â˜… Expert panel review are highest confidence. Two-star variants have moderate confidence from multiple submitters.

faq.question: What is the difference between VCV, RCV, and SCV accessions?
faq.answer: VCV (VariationArchive) aggregates all data for a variant. RCV (Record) is variant-condition pair. SCV (Submission) is individual submitter interpretation.

faq.question: How do I get faster API responses from NCBI?
faq.answer: Register for a free NCBI API key to increase rate limits from 3 to 10 requests per second. Add api_key=<YOUR_KEY> to all requests.

faq.question: Is ClinVar data safe for direct clinical diagnosis?
faq.answer: No. ClinVar is a database of submitted interpretations. Always involve a genetics professional for clinical decision-making.

faq.question: Why do some variants have conflicting classifications?
faq.answer: Different submitters may interpret evidence differently. Check individual submission details, review status, and evidence criteria before making conclusions.

faq.question: How does ClinVar compare to other variant databases?
faq.answer: ClinVar is the most comprehensive public archive with submissions from clinical labs worldwide. Use alongside databases like LOVD, HGMD, or ClinGen for comprehensive variant interpretation.
